Description.author: Wojciech Trocki
Description.to:
Provide top level diagrams for Raincatcher.
Describe modules - what value they adding, how to use and extend them. 
Describe top level api and framework that will be used in Raincatcher.

Steps to Reproduce.author: Vitalii Chepeliuk
Steps to Reproduce.to:
# Open [Workers] side menu (/)
# Press [New Worker] button (/)
# Press [Cancel] button in right corner (/)
# Operation is cancelled (x)

Steps to Reproduce.author: Vitalii Chepeliuk
Steps to Reproduce.to:
# Login into Portal (/)
# Open [Workers] side menu (/)
# Press [New Worker] button (/)
# Fill all required fields (/)
# Press [Create Worker] button (/)
# Worker should be in workers list (x)
*Workaround*
# Press [Scheduler] side menu (/)
# Press [Workers] side menu (/)
# You should see TWorker (/)

Description.author: Wojciech Trocki
Description.from:
Mediator is required now in every module because of topic utility. 
We should remove it and expose topic utility in mediator.
Description.to:
Mediator is required now in every module because of topic utility. 
We should remove it and expose topic utility in mediator.

Description.author: Wojciech Trocki
Description.from:
Mediator is required now in every module because of topic utility. 
We should remove it and expose topic utility in mediator.
Description.to:
h4. Motivation

Expose topic utility on mediator object in order to remove strict dependency on mediator in many modules

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers refactoring the messaging functionality in the raincatcher-demo-mobile and raincatcher-demo-portal applications into the raincatcher-message module.

The module should then be split into 

- raincatcher-message-core
- raincatcher-message-angular

Description.author: Paolo Bueno
Description.from:
h3. What

This task covers refactoring the messaging functionality in the raincatcher-demo-mobile and raincatcher-demo-portal applications into the raincatcher-message module.

The module should then be split into 

- raincatcher-message-core
- raincatcher-message-angular
Description.to:
h3. What

fh-wfm-message supplies functionality that will not be worth maintaining moving forward.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the workflow.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a workflow on-device. This will highlight to users if a workflow has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

h3. How

h4. Subscribing to the remote topics

See example in the Epic.

h4. Adding the sync status to the template 

The workflow sync status should be displayed as part of the work order.

- In the workflow list, there should be an icon to identify the status of the sync.
- In the workflow details, the sync status should also be displayed, along with any error messages.

Description.author: Jameel Briones
Description.from:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the workflow.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a workflow on-device. This will highlight to users if a workflow has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

h3. How

h4. Subscribing to the remote topics

See example in the Epic.

h4. Adding the sync status to the template 

The workflow sync status should be displayed as part of the work order.

- In the workflow list, there should be an icon to identify the status of the sync.
- In the workflow details, the sync status should also be displayed, along with any error messages.
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the workflow.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a workflow on-device. This will highlight to users if a workflow has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

h3. How

h4. Subscribing to the remote topics

This is going to be implemented in the raincatcher-sync module. It should subscribe to the `remote_update_applied` and `remote_update_failed` sync topics.

h4. Adding the sync status to the template 

- In the workflow list, there should be an icon to identify the status of the sync, along with any error messages

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Niall Donnelly
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the result.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a work order result on-device. This will highlight to users if a work order result has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

h3. How

h4. Subscribing to the remote topics

See example in the Epic.

h4. Adding the sync status to the template 

The workorder result sync status should be displayed as part of the work order.

- In the workorder result list, there should be an icon to identify the status of the sync.
- In the workorder result details, the sync status should also be displayed, along with any error messages.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the workorder.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a work order on-device. This will highlight to users if a work order has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of subscribers to the two notification topics (See epic) for remote sync status and the update to the views to identify the sync status of the workorder.

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a work order on-device. This will highlight to users if a work order has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Niall Donnelly
Jameel Briones
Description.to:
h3. What

This task covers the implementation of the update of the views to identify the sync status of a workorder. 

h3. Why

This will allow users to view the current sync status of a work order on-device. This will highlight to users if a work order has encountered an error syncing to the remote data store.

h3. How

Subscription to the remote topics has been implemented in raincatcher-sync. The sync status is included in the workorder object as *workorder._syncStatus*

h4. Adding the sync status to the template 
In the workorder list, the sync status should be displayed by adding an icon and an error message to the [template|https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-workorder-angular/blob/master/lib/template/workorder-list.tpl.html#L23]

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.to:
h3. What

This is a task to create the raincatcher-store-workorder-mongoose module. 

This module will subscribe to the user CRUDL topics.

h3. Why

This module will allow raincatcher developers to easily integrate a mongoose store.

h3. How

Create a new module called raincatcher-store-workorder-mongoose.

h4. Schemas

h5. Workorder

The schema should have the following properties based on the existing workorder model. [Mongoose validators|http://mongoosejs.com/docs/validation.html] should be used to validate the parameters of the workorder.

{code:java}
{
   id:"rkX1fdSH",
   workflowId:'SyVXyMuSr',
   assignee:'rkX1fdSH',
   type:'Job Order',
   title:'Footpath in disrepair',
   status:'New',
   startTimestamp:'2015-10-22T14:00:00Z',
   address:'1795 Davie St, Vancouver, BC V6G 2M9',
   location:[
      49.287227,
      -123.141489
   ],
   summary:'Please remove damaged kerb and SUPPLY AND FIX 1X DROP KERB CENTRE BN 125 X 150 cart away from site outside number 3.'
}
{code}

h3. Verification steps

https://testing.eu.feedhenry.com/box/srv/1.1/wid/testing/studio/r55tw3zksyjjz67bc6tzfugp/file/www/index.html?fh_destination_code=studio&fh_apptitle=WFM%20Demo%20Mobile%20App&url=https://testing-r55tw36wqrhdxc7oviaepzk7-dev.mbaas1.eu.feedhenry.com#/files

3) Reload page and check if picture is still there
4) Check if picture was saved in database
